title: Riviera police: Gunman says fatal shooting was self-defense
content:
The man who fatally shot a 16-year-old last night called city police not long after to confess to the shooting, police said.
The unidentified 23-year-old told police he shot the teen in self-defense because the 16-year-old had shot at him. The man led police to the gun he’d used in the encounter.
The shooting happened at about 9:15 Thursday night on West 28th Street, just west of President Barack Obama Highway, police said. The teen was taken to a hospital with a gunshot wound to the abdomen. He died at the hospital from those injuries, police said.
The teen’s death marks the ninth confirmed homicide in Riviera Beach this year, according to a Palm Beach Post database. There have now been 67 confirmed homicides in Palm Beach County during 2016.
Anyone with information about the teen’s death is asked to contact Riviera Beach police at 561-845-4123 or Crime Stoppers of Palm Beach County at 800-458-TIPS (8477).
